reviews.review_msg: Please avoid her. Take this class with anyone else.

This is a hard course and she doesn't make it any easier. Her explanations aren't bad but she mumbles a lot and her accent is strong. She kind of speeds through the hard topics. Be ready to do a lot of the work on your own and watch videos on YouTube. The course did seem to get better towards the end. Computing assignments were a bit complicated.
what the sigma

Don't go to the lectures, it's a waste of time. The textbook is great, it explains concepts quickly and the practice questions help you get a grasp for the content. If you use the textbook for the whole semester, this class is probably an easy B+.

this profs inexperience was VERY apparent. she spoke very fast and mumbled alot. unless you sat in the front row there is no way of hearing what she said. explanations dont make sense even if you could hear, and her lecture slides cannot be read from afar and are extremely messy. quite possibly the worst prof i've ever had, avoid at all costs.

This prof is TERRIBLE at lecturing. She speaks too fast and too quietly, with a thick accent, during the entire lecture. She also doesn't like to answer questions students have during lecture, rarely actually giving a good answer. Definitely avoid, watch Brenda's videos and read the textbook instead.

She is very VERY bad at teaching, but atleast she is organized and is available for help outside the lecture. In a class of about 200 people, only 10 people show up. I think that should summarize her teaching abilities. So, DO NOT take this course with her, if you have no other choice, then watch Brenda's youtube videos and self-study.
Good, I would take her again

She is the type of Prof that is meant to teach in University. USELESS lecture, but always available to answer students' questions on Canvas discussion, and answer it VERY DETAIL & FAST. Overall, just self-study, don't show up except for quizzes and exams, ask questions on Canvas Discussion and you will perform well. Exam are 7-8/10 difficulties.

Around 180 people in the lecture with only 30 people who actually show up. As one of the people who show up, sit at the front as she has an accent and she is pretty quiet. Overall, she teaches good, tells you eactly what to expect, goes over sample questions for midterms. However, I would say Brenda is better since you'll understand Brenda more.

she represents everything a dedicated educator should strive to avoid. She is incompetent and lacks preparation, I implore the university administration to reevaluate their hiring and retention policies to ensure that future generations of students are spared the indignity of enduring such a subpar learning environment.

she demonstrated a blatant disregard for student engagement and participation. Questions were dismissed with curt, dismissive responses, discouraging any form of intellectual curiosity or critical thinking among students. This hostile environment stifled creativity and discouraged students from actively participating in their own learning process.

Her lack of preparation was glaringly evident in every lecture. Their presentations were disorganized, often jumping from one topic to another without any coherent structure. As a result, comprehension suffered, and class discussions devolved into aimless confusion rather than meaningful discourse.

As a student invested in both my education and the quality of instruction, it's with deep disappointment that I must address the abysmal teaching standards set forth by her. My encounter with her left me not only disillusioned but also questioning the integrity of the academic institution that employs such an incompetent individual.
I think deciphering hieroglyphics might be easier than this woman's lectures. If u believe in god consider this ur divine intervention and DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

I can't really put this woman's teaching style into words. She simply goes through the motions and does not really care. She lectures without real aim and doesn't give clear instructions on assignments but keeps saying "Its easy". Do yourself a favour and find a different prof.
Hey worse prof ever. Yours truly Daniel.

If you want to fail the class, go ahead. You wouldn't understand a word she says, such a heavy accent. Too fast-paced, as if talking to herself. I would suggest waiting another semester if you can, otherwise, attending her lectures is a waste of time. Rather study on your own.

Her notes are actually pretty good, but its her accent and general speed that makes everyone hate her, If I have to pre write notes in order to stay on track, that's a red flag, first quiz was fair for the most part, wouldn't take her again. But people are over exaggerating how bad she is though tbh like shes not THAT bad, but definetly not good.

She comes to class with notes already filled out so that she doesn't need to write in class and rush through the lecture. Taking away the whole point of skeleton notes and chance for students to ask questions as they solve examples together. Just grab a student to read the textbook to the class and it will be the same. Oh wait but she gets paid!

Respectfully, this teacher makes a difficult course more difficult. 
She rushes through material without any care in the world. She does not focus nor care for her student's understanding as she often prefers to finish early than rather dive slowly and carefully into IMPORTANT topics.
I hope she or SFU can make some dire changes to this disaster.

Umm. How to start? Not only is she respectful but she is very helpful. She tends to go way too fast during lectures hence 150 people dropping after the first day, and is very hard to understand, but she seems to care about her lectures. Do not ask questions in class go to the office hours.
SFU's faculty is a complete joke. this woman is completely incapable of teaching, god help us all.
just no. Dont botjer with this prof
Fatemah is so awesome I fell in love with linear algebra.
bruh
she says just listen to her lectures and dont take notes, but its impossible to understand what she says not to forget how fast she goes through the notes.

Now I don't want to insult a professor for having poor english skills, but it really must be said that she can barely speak english. She has an extremely heavy accent that makes her lectures nearly impossible to understand; the lectures are also dull, rushed, and not very helpful compared to just reading the textbook. Highly recommend to avoid.
High expectations for students, good pace, lectures can be hard to follow at times.
LOL GET OUT IF YOU CAN

sigh.. WHAT THE ACTUAL F ... i was questioning my life decisions that led me to sitting through a lecture that is laughable and so frustrating. It's like she's just mumbling to herself the entire time without giving two f about anyone else. PLEASE AVOID THIS DISASTEROUS CLASS FOR YOUR SANITY. i am so close to crying

This is unbelievable!! Professor refuses to answer students questions, won't slow down when asked to and does not even speak clearly. I cannot understand a damn thing she says. Plus she cares more about finishing on time rather than producing good quality lecture material. Probably the worst professor at SFU by far. DO NOT TAKE, WITH THIS PROFESSOR
who in the right mind at SFU thought this was a good idea...

Zooms through the lecture...
I can see why 140+ students swapped to the other professor
what the actual hell.
first two lectures in and the ratings are already in lol, sums it up

Based on what other have said, everything is true. She tells students NOT to ask questions and gets irritated when asked questions. Tells students they can find the material outside of class (what is the point of lectures if this is the case.) She seems to not give a sh#t about anyone or the course. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Just watch Brenda's videos.

WORST PROF EVER! She doesn't speak clearly or loudly. She does not slow down or zoom into lecture notes. When students' have questions, she does not answer and tells you to watch the videos or go to the algebra workshop. What is the point of the professor being there It seems as she does not care about the course nor the student's understanding.

I can't hear her, I can't see her, and she mumbles a lot. In addition, she is very good at yapping, and she goes too fast when teaching. She activley discourages students from asking questions and has an attitude towards students, AVOID AT ALL COSTS NEVER EVER TAKE A COURSE WITH HER!!!!

INSANE. Ignoring the completely incomprehensible accent that makes listening to lectures impossible to do, this lady also teaches hilariously fast. I have never seen a class with so many students looking completely lost in my life!! Just watch Brenda's youtube videos and don't bother attending lectures. DON'T WALK, RUN!
Oh that's not-

completely unable to understand, absolutely way too fast. If you take math 232 with her, you will learn everything from watching youtube videos rather than the lectures. Save yourself the trouble and avoid taking the course with her.
This prof gives Janice Regan a run for her money!
Can't understand her. She is way too fast. Doesn't answer questions. DO NOT TAKE.

Impossible to understand, refused to speak up, zoom in, or brighten her screen. She played it off and said we can find videos online or to use her filled in notes instead of trying to make lectures teachable. When asked to slow down she refused and said lectures are only 50 minutes so just listen.
first lecture was horrible, went too fast, barely understood what she was saying, and she skips through a lot of her own notes.

Saieed is a super nice guy and does his best to teach his class well and allow all student to succeed. Do his all practice problems and assignments and you are guarenteed to at least pass. As he will tell you exam questions are based directly off the assigned textbook problems. Try to understand the theory early on.

This is a hard class but the prof teaches in a way that helps reinforces the concepts. You likely will have to learn concepts on your own because of the nature of the class. The class does well and he does not scale. Practice all assigned practice problems.

Saieed is a genuine professor that has exceptional knowledge of Linear Algebra. His lectures are detailed and provides examples of each sub-topic, which help with understanding the concept. He was fair with all of the assessments, giving advice for each. Great prof but unfortunately, he is not going to be teaching at SFU no more.

Prof Akbari is genuinely a good prof and can be humorous. He constantly reminds us to do 2x2 matrix determinants before we go to sleep (a class running joke)! He's always starting and ending lectures right on time. His quizzes are a breeze (he picks the easiest questions from the assignments)! Do your assignments and you're golden for his exams!

He was a great prof taught really well and assignments as well as exams were fair. however it is a hard class but the prof was a gem. Its too bad he is going back to Iran SFU needs more profs like him. Just such a nice person even started cracking jokes in leactures by the time he had gotten to know some of us. Overall enjoyed his class.

Best class I have taken so far. Always looked forward in doing work and attending his lectures. Write and listen to all that he says, take note of equations and techniques. Do all the assignments he gives, by then you will be prepared to answer all the questions for the quizzes and midterms.
Top professor

He's an amazing prof. Caring and compassionate towards students, very knowledgeable and explain things clearly so it's easy to follow. He always patiently asks the questions after class and spends sometimes an hour after. I think he's new here but he tries his best to help. Highly recommend taking classes with him!

Great professor with clear lectures. Linear algebra can be a heavy subject but he does his best to clarify all the material. Take advantage of the office hours as he is very helpful, and explains things well even if you ask "dumb" questions.

One of the best professors I've ever had. He is extremely knowledgeable about the subject matter and his lectures are easy to follow and thorough. He is very accessible if you have any questions and spends at least 40 minutes after class answering students' questions. 100% recommend taking Linear Algebra with him
He is so nice. He cares students a lot. He will be willing to help others if you are passionate.
Great professor, very approachable and exams were fair to students who did the homework problems.

Really straightforward course. Exam questions are pulled straight from the extra questions from the assignments that go with the quizzes. Textbook isn't mandatory but it helped a lot with regular practice.

Amazing professor who teaches concepts in a very simple and understandable way regardless of his accent. Quizzes, assignments, midterms and finals were all VERY fair. Very funny prof, never late to his lectures, stayed to answered any and all questions after class, just overall an amazing guy. If you have the chance to take 232 with Saieed do it.
Amazing professor. His exams are literally just the additional questions he posts, so they're very easy to study for. The people giving him low scores clearly didn't complete the homework questions.

Lectures are fast-paced and hard to keep up with, and notes aren't posted after class.That being said, ~80% of the exam questions were pulled DIRECTLY from the homework assignments/quizzes, so doing and understanding the hw is a guaranteed decent grade. Saieed is very kind and wants students to do well on the exams, so do the hw and you'll be good!

Pretty good linear algebra professor. His accent is a little heavy, but makes his pronunciation of words funny. There are biweekly quizzes (in class) that help you study for exams, and online assignments using matlab that are marked pretty lightly. 2 midterms that were relatively easy for a math course (70 and 80 averages). 

I recommend.
dude reads the slides word for word and can't give understandable answers to questions. Don't bother going to lectures just watch brenda davison and do text book question.
lectures are way too hard to follow. you will end up teaching yourself this course!
